About Me

Some things about me...

BIO

I am currently a student at the University of Toronto, studying Computer Engineering. My current co-op is at IBM, where I am working as a Site Reliability Engineer (or a DevOps Developer for you common folk).

I am a man of many interests. I enjoy sports such as basketball, football (both of them), volleyball, and basically everything else. I enjoy creating and innovating, in whichever form those come in; that could be from programming, to building sandcastles, and everything in between.

Anyways, I'm sure you're getting sleepy reading all of this. Me too. Feel free to reach out if you want to know more!

IBM

DevOps Developer | SRE

Coding and designing API endpoints, data input and entry using Postgresql, chatops, runbook automation. In the SRE team at IBM, these projects have helped expand and develop my growing skillset!

As SREs, we are users of a DevOps methodology. This has provided me experience with Agile development tools such as JIRA, Kanban, git, and more.

Walmart

Customer Service Specialist

My experience as a customer service specialist at Walmart Canada helped grow my interpersonal skills, whether that was cooperating with my team, or assisting a customer. I was recognized multiple times by my managers for showing initiative and having exceptional people skills.
